item.title: Bahāristān-i Jāmī.
notes: Paper; thick cream-colored laid paper with no visible watermarks in poor condition with some damp staining to the top edge and extensive worm damage throughout. Black ink with rubrication; few marginal notes and corrections.
Manuscript is incomplete; the text breaks off shortly after the beginning of book (rawz̤ah) 7.
Place of writing not recorded, possibly Iran.
Browne, E. G. Literary history of Persia, volume 3, page 515
Several lines of poetry on endpaper.
Nastaʻlīq script; 20 lines in written area 17 x 8.5 cm.
Library of Congress Persian manuscript, M37.
Contemporary cardboard binding with a cloth spine.
Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.
summary: Collection of memorable sayings, witticisms, anecdotes, etc., in prose and poetry in 8 books; concerning (book 1) Sufis and saints, 2) sayings of the philosophers, 3) justice of kings, 4) generosity, 5) love, 6) jokes and witticisms, 7) poets, and 8) on animals; the text is incompete and breaks off shortly after the beginning of book 7.
medium: 1, 64, 4 leaves (20 lines) bound : paper ; 22 x 12.8 cm

subject: manuscripts, persian
iran
washington (d.c.)
